description.value:
Age. Sanguinar reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, but then age incredibly slow living to the 700 or more years.

Creature Type. You are Undead.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your walking speed is 35 feet.

Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

Deathless Nature. You are neither truly dead nor alive, a fact represented by the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplCloudkill0]{Cloudkill} and @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplStinkingCl]{Stinking Cloud} effects, inhaled Poisons, and the Breath Weapons of some dragons).
  • You have advantage on death saving throws.
  • You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe.
  • You do not need to sleep, and magic can not put you to sleep.

Crimson Talent. You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

Sanguin Bite. Your fanged bite is a natural weapons which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (You choose this when you select this species), instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

When you attack with this bite and hit a creature that is not a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways of your choice:

  • You can expend one Hit Die to regain health.
  • You can roll a d4 on the next ability check or attack roll you make, adding it to the result. If the ability is one from your Crimson Talent then you roll 2d4.

You can empower yourself a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Spider Climb. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. Starting at 5th level, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

Stillness in Sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

Revenance. As your nature blurs the lines of life and undeath, spells that preserve life that do not normally affect undead, work on you.

Furthermore, you are immune against any effect the turns undead.

configuration.hint: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

Your fanged bite is a natural weapon which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier (choose below), instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

Core rule that provides a bonus based on character level and intelligence modifier at levels 6, 12, 18.  Does NOT apply retroactively and is not affected by temporary changes in Intelligence stat (from items or other buffs/debuffs).
